intro: Gilibertia elongata, commonly known as the false mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often hairy and branched. It thrives in dry, disturbed habitats and is often found in grasslands and savannas. Gilibertia elongata is also known for its edible tuberous roots, which are used in traditional medicine and cuisine.
